conclusion: Analyze the v-t graphs of both cars to determine their positions at t = 10 s.
Car A's v-t graph is a horizontal line at v = 40 m/s, indicating constant speed.
Car B's v-t graph is a straight line passing through the origin, indicating increasing velocity.
Determine the slope of Car B's v-t graph as 2 m/sÂ² from the change in velocity over time.
Equation of Car B's v-t graph is v = 2t.
Calculate distance traveled by Car A at t = 10 s as 400 m using constant speed.
Calculate distance traveled by Car B at t = 10 s as 100 m using area under the graph.
Both cars start at the same point at t = 0 s.
Position of Car A at t = 10 s is 400 m.
Position of Car B at t = 10 s is 100 m.
Compare positions: Car A is ahead of Car B at t = 10 s.
Final answer: Car A is ahead.
